description:
The Sentinel-1 mission provides data from a dual-polarization
C-band Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) instrument at 5.405GHz (C band).  This collection
includes the S1 Ground Range Detected (GRD) scenes, processed
using the Sentinel-1 Toolbox to generate a calibrated, ortho-corrected
product. The collection is updated daily. New assets are ingested
within two days after they become available.

This collection
contains all of the GRD scenes.  Each scene has one of 3 resolutions
(10, 25 or 40 meters), 4 band combinations (corresponding to
scene polarization) and 3 instrument modes.  Use of the collection
in a mosaic context will likely require filtering down to a homogeneous
set of bands and parameters.  See
[this article](https://developers.google.com/earth-engine/sentinel1)
for details of collection use and preprocessing. Each scene contains
either 1 or 2 out of 4 possible polarization bands, depending
on the instrument's polarization settings.  The possible combinations
are single band VV, single band HH, dual band VV+VH, and dual band HH+HV:

  1. VV: single co-polarization, vertical transmit/vertical receive
  2. HH: single co-polarization, horizontal transmit/horizontal receive
  3. VV + VH: dual-band cross-polarization, vertical transmit/horizontal
  receive
  4. HH + HV: dual-band cross-polarization, horizontal transmit/vertical
  receive

Each scene also includes an additional 'angle' band that contains
the approximate incidence angle from ellipsoid in degrees at every point.
This band is generated by interpolating the 'incidenceAngle' property
of the 'geolocationGridPoint' gridded field provided with each asset.

Each scene was pre-processed with
[Sentinel-1 Toolbox](https://earth.esa.int/eogateway/tools/sentinel-1-toolbox)
using the following steps:

  1. Thermal noise removal
  2. Radiometric calibration
  3. Terrain correction using SRTM 30 or ASTER DEM for areas greater than
     60 degrees latitude, where SRTM is not available.
The final terrain-corrected values are converted to decibels via log scaling
(10*log10(x)).

For more information about these pre-processing steps, please refer to the
[Sentinel-1 Pre-processing
article](https://developers.google.com/earth-engine/sentinel1). For further
advice on working with Sentinel-1 imagery, see [Guido Lemoine's tutorial on SAR
basics](https://developers.google.com/earth-engine/tutorials/community/sar-basics)
and [Mort Canty's tutorial on SAR change
detection](https://developers.google.com/earth-engine/tutorials/community/detecting-changes-in-sentinel-1-imagery-pt-1).

This collection is computed on-the-fly. If you want to use the underlying
collection with raw power values (which is updated faster), see
COPERNICUS/S1_GRD_FLOAT.
gee:terms_of_use:
The use of Sentinel data is governed by the [Copernicus
Sentinel Data Terms and Conditions.](https://sentinels.copernicus.eu/documents/247904/690755/Sentinel_Data_Legal_Notice))

gee:schema.description: Name of the country where the facility is located. This element is configurable within the IPF.
gee:schema.name: GRD_Post_Processing_facility_country

gee:schema.description:
Name of the facility where the processing step was
performed. This element is configurable within the IPF.
gee:schema.name: GRD_Post_Processing_facility_name

gee:schema.description:
Name of the organisation responsible for the facility.
This element is configurable within the IPF.
gee:schema.name: GRD_Post_Processing_facility_organisation

gee:schema.description:
Geographical location of the facility. This element
is configurable within the IPF.
gee:schema.name: GRD_Post_Processing_facility_site

gee:schema.description: Name of the software.
gee:schema.name: GRD_Post_Processing_software_name

gee:schema.description: Software version identification.
gee:schema.name: GRD_Post_Processing_software_version

gee:schema.description: Processing start time.
gee:schema.name: GRD_Post_Processing_start

gee:schema.description: Processing stop time.
gee:schema.name: GRD_Post_Processing_stop

gee:schema.description:
Name of the country where the facility is located.
This element is configurable within the IPF.
gee:schema.name: SLC_Processing_facility_country

gee:schema.description:
Name of the facility where the processing step was
performed. This element is configurable within the IPF.
gee:schema.name: SLC_Processing_facility_name

gee:schema.description:
Name of the organisation responsible for the facility.
This element is configurable within the IPF.
gee:schema.name: SLC_Processing_facility_organisation

gee:schema.description: Geographical location of the facility. This element is configurable within the IPF.
gee:schema.name: SLC_Processing_facility_site

gee:schema.description: Name of the software.
gee:schema.name: SLC_Processing_software_name

gee:schema.description: Software version identification.
gee:schema.name: SLC_Processing_software_version

gee:schema.description: Processing start time.
gee:schema.name: SLC_Processing_start

gee:schema.description: Processing stop time.
gee:schema.name: SLC_Processing_stop

gee:schema.description: Sentinel-1 Toolbox calibration tool version.
gee:schema.name: S1TBX_Calibration_Operator_version

gee:schema.description: Sentinel-1 Toolbox SAR processing tool version.
gee:schema.name: S1TBX_SAR_Processing_version

gee:schema.description: Sentinel Application Platform (SNAP) version.
gee:schema.name: SNAP_Graph_Processing_Framework_GPF_version

gee:schema.description:
Sensing start time of the input data relative to the
ascending node crossing. This is a count of the time elapsed
since the orbit ascending node crossing [ms].
gee:schema.name: startTimeANX

gee:schema.description:
Sensing stop time of the input data relative to the
ascending node crossing. This is a count of the time elapsed
since the orbit ascending node crossing [ms].
gee:schema.name: stopTimeANX

gee:schema.description:
Uniquely identifies the mission according to standards
defined by the World Data Center for Satellite Information (WDC-SI),
available [here](https://nssdc.gsfc.nasa.gov/nmc/SpacecraftQuery.jsp).
gee:schema.name: nssdcIdentifier

gee:schema.description: The full mission name. E.g. "SENTINEL-1"
gee:schema.name: familyName

gee:schema.description: The alphanumeric identifier of the platform within the mission.
gee:schema.name: platform_number

gee:schema.description: Platform heading relative to North, degrees
gee:schema.name: platformHeading

gee:schema.description: Information related to the instrument on the platform to which acquired the data.
gee:schema.name: instrument

gee:schema.description:
IW (Interferometric Wide Swath), SM (Strip Map), or EW (Extra Wide Swath).
See [product details](https://sentiwiki.copernicus.eu/web/s1-products).
gee:schema.name: instrumentMode

gee:schema.description:
List of the swaths contained within a product. Most
products will contain only one swath, except for TOPS SLC products
which include 3 or 5 swaths.
gee:schema.name: instrumentSwath

gee:schema.description: Absolute orbit number of the oldest line within the image data.
gee:schema.name: orbitNumber_start

gee:schema.description: Absolute orbit number of the most recent line within the image data.
gee:schema.name: orbitNumber_stop

gee:schema.description: Relative orbit number of the oldest line within the image data.
gee:schema.name: relativeOrbitNumber_start

gee:schema.description: Relative orbit number of the most recent line within the image data.
gee:schema.name: relativeOrbitNumber_stop

gee:schema.description: Absolute sequence number of the mission cycle to which the oldest image data applies.
gee:schema.name: cycleNumber

gee:schema.description: Id of the mission phase to which the oldest image data applies.
gee:schema.name: phaseIdentifier

gee:schema.description:
Direction of the orbit ('ASCENDING' or 'DESCENDING')
for the oldest image data in the product (the start of the product).
gee:schema.name: orbitProperties_pass

gee:schema.description:
UTC time of the ascending node of the orbit. This
element is present for all products except ASAR L2 OCN products
which are generated from an ASAR L1 input.
gee:schema.name: orbitProperties_ascendingNodeTime

gee:schema.description: H for high or M for medium.
gee:schema.name: resolution

gee:schema.description: Resolution in meters.
gee:schema.name: resolution_meters

gee:schema.description: The instrument configuration ID (Radar database ID) for this data.
gee:schema.name: instrumentConfigurationID

gee:schema.description: Unique ID of the datatake within the mission.
gee:schema.name: missionDataTakeID

gee:schema.description:
Transmit/Receive polarisation for the data. There
is one element for each Tx/Rx combination: ['VV'], ['HH'],
['VV', 'VH'], or ['HH', 'HV'].
gee:schema.name: transmitterReceiverPolarisation

gee:schema.description: Output product class "A" for Annotation or "S" for Standard.
gee:schema.name: productClass

gee:schema.description: Textual description of the output product class.
gee:schema.name: productClassDescription

gee:schema.description:
The composition type of this product:
"Individual", "Slice", or "Assembled".
gee:schema.name: productComposition

gee:schema.description: The product type (correction level) of this product.
gee:schema.name: productType

gee:schema.description:
Describes the required timeliness of the processing.
One of: NRT-10m, NRT-1h, NRT-3h, Fast-24h, Off-line, or Reprocessing
gee:schema.name: productTimelinessCategory

gee:schema.description: True if this is a slice from a larger product or false if this is a complete product.
gee:schema.name: sliceProductFlag

gee:schema.description:
Sensing start time of the segment to which this slice
belongs. This field is only present if sliceProductFlag = true
gee:schema.name: segmentStartTime

gee:schema.description:
Absolute slice number of this slice starting at 1.
This field is only present if sliceProductFlag = true.
gee:schema.name: sliceNumber

gee:schema.description:
Total number of slices in the complete data take.
This field is only present if sliceProductFlag = true.
gee:schema.name: totalSlices

title: Sentinel-1 SAR GRD: C-band Synthetic Aperture Radar Ground Range Detected, log scaling
